name: google_search
description: A Google search result API. When you need a short and clear answer to a specific question, you can use it. The input should be a search query.

k.description: Select the first k results in the search results as the response.

name: search_pubmed

auth.docs: Optional Entrez API key for higher rate limits.

description: Search PubMed for biomedical literature and return a list of PubMed IDs.

max_results.description: The maximum number of PubMed IDs to return.

page_size.description: Batch size to request from the Entrez API.

datetype.description: Date field to filter on (e.g., PDAT).

name: search_pmc

auth.docs: Optional Entrez API key for higher rate limits.

description: Search PubMed Central for open access biomedical literature and return PMC IDs.

max_results.description: The maximum number of PMC IDs to return.

page_size.description: Batch size to request from the Entrez API.

has_abstract.description: Limit results to articles with abstracts.

name: webpage_fetch

idempotency_key.guidance: Use the normalized target URL as the idempotency key to avoid duplicate fetches.

description: Download an allowlisted webpage, strip scripts and ads, and return clean text with the resolved title and URL.

url.description: HTTP or HTTPS URL to fetch. Must belong to an allowlisted domain.

name: get_current_info
description: Get the current time, date, day, month and year, or timestamp based on the format specified.

name: policy_reference
description: Retrieve internal safety and governance policy guidance relevant to a proposed action.

query.description: Natural language description of the planned action or request requiring review.

policy_ids.description: Optional explicit policy identifiers to include in the response.

categories.description: Optional list of policy categories to filter by.

include_full_text.description: Whether to return full guidance text for each policy.

limit.description: Maximum number of policy entries to return.

name: context_tracker
description: Compile a normalized snapshot of the active conversation including recent highlights and participants.

conversation_id.description: Identifier for the conversation being summarized.

conversation_history.description: Recent ordered messages that should be normalized into the snapshot.

summary.description: Optional summary override for the generated snapshot.

highlights.description: Optional list of pre-selected highlight strings.

name: geocode_location
description: Look up latitude and longitude coordinates for a user-specified location string using OpenWeather's geocoding API.

location.description: City name, state code (US only), and optional country code separated by commas.

name: get_current_location
description: Retrieve the caller's approximate location using the IP-API geolocation service.

name: priority_queue
description: Score and sort operational tasks to produce a prioritized execution list.

tasks.description: Tasks to be evaluated and sorted.

default_priority.description: Priority level to use when a task does not specify one.

limit.description: Optional maximum number of tasks to return.

reference_time.description: Override the timestamp used when computing urgency.

name: debian12_calendar

idempotency_key.guidance: Provide a stable key for read operations when polling. Omit the key when issuing create, update, or delete requests.

description: Interact with the Debian 12 on-device calendar to list, search, inspect, and manage events.

event_id.description: Identifier of the event to fetch, update, or delete.

query.description: Text used to search titles, descriptions, and locations when operation is 'search'.

start.description: ISO 8601 timestamp that bounds the window for list/search operations or sets the start of a created/updated event.

end.description: ISO 8601 timestamp that bounds the window for list/search operations or sets the end of a created/updated event.

calendar.description: Optional calendar identifier (e.g., ICS file stem or account id).

limit.description: Maximum number of events to return for list/search operations.

title.description: Event title when creating or updating an entry.

description.description: Optional event description for create/update operations.

all_day.description: Whether the created or updated event should be treated as an all-day entry.

attendees.description: List of attendees to include when creating or updating an event.

idempotency_guidance: Reads are idempotent and may use a stable key when polling. Create, update, and delete operations mutate the calendar and should not be retried automatically.

name: execute_python
description: Execute Python code inside a sandboxed interpreter with stdout capture and timeout enforcement.

name: execute_javascript
description: Execute JavaScript with a sandboxed runtime that captures stdout, stderr, and generated files.

files.description: Optional files to seed into the sandboxed working directory.

path.description: Relative file path inside the sandbox.

content.description: File contents as UTF-8 text or base64 encoded data.

encoding.description: Encoding used to interpret the provided content.

name: terminal_command

idempotency_key.guidance: Combine the normalized command tokens and working directory to deduplicate retried executions.

description: Execute a constrained terminal command inside the ATLAS sandbox and return stdout, stderr, and exit status.

command.description: Command to execute. Supply a shell-free string or a tokenized list where the first item is the command and remaining items populate positional arguments without using the optional arguments field.

timeout.description: Maximum number of seconds to allow the command to run before timing out.

working_directory.description: Optional working directory relative to the sandbox root.

name: filesystem_read

idempotency_key.guidance: Use the normalized sandbox-relative path combined with any read constraints (e.g., max_bytes) to deduplicate retries.

description: Read a file from the sandboxed filesystem, returning MIME metadata and optionally truncated contents.

path.description: Sandbox-relative path of the file to read.

max_bytes.description: Optional override to reduce the default read quota in bytes.

name: filesystem_write

idempotency_key.guidance: Combine the sandbox-relative path with a stable content hash to prevent duplicate writes.

description: Write or overwrite a file within the sandboxed filesystem while enforcing byte and total storage quotas.

content.description: Text or base64 encoded payload to write.

mode.description: Interpretation mode for the provided content.

encoding.description: Text encoding used when mode is 'text'.

overwrite.description: If false, refuse to overwrite an existing file.

name: filesystem_list

idempotency_key.guidance: Use the sandbox-relative directory path and any listing options to deduplicate retries.

description: List directory contents within the sandbox, returning metadata for each entry.

path.description: Sandbox-relative directory path. Defaults to the sandbox root when omitted.

include_hidden.description: Whether to include dot-prefixed entries in results.

max_entries.description: Optional limit to further restrict the number of returned entries.

name: structured_parse

idempotency_key.guidance: Use a content hash of the parsed document when deduplicating calls.

description: Extract normalized text, tables, and metadata from PDF, DOCX, HTML, CSV, or image documents.

path.description: Filesystem path to the document relative to the sandbox root.

source_format.description: Explicit document format hint when supplying raw bytes.

target_formats.description: Subset of output blocks to include in the response.

name: kv_get

idempotency_key.guidance: Combine the namespace and key when deduplicating cacheable reads.

description: Retrieve a JSON-serializable value from the namespaced state store, honoring key TTL.

key.description: Key to retrieve within the namespace.

name: kv_set

idempotency_key.guidance: Use the namespace and key plus a deterministic value hash when retrying writes.

idempotency_guidance: Writes mutate the key's value. Provide a stable idempotency token derived from the namespace, key, and value hash when retrying.
description: Persist a JSON-serializable value within the namespaced state store with optional TTL enforcement.

namespace.description: Logical namespace that owns the key.

ttl_seconds.description: Optional expiration in seconds. Values must be greater than zero when provided.

name: kv_delete

idempotency_key.guidance: Combine namespace and key to safely retry deletions.

idempotency_guidance: Deletes remove the key entirely. Retry requests should reuse the namespace/key-based idempotency token.
description: Remove a key from the namespaced state store if present.

namespace.description: Namespace containing the key to delete.

name: kv_increment

idempotency_key.guidance: Combine the namespace, key, and deterministic increment batch identifier when retrying.

idempotency_guidance: Increment operations mutate counters. Supply a stable idempotency key for batched increments to prevent double-application.
description: Atomically increment an integer counter within the namespaced state store, creating it when missing.

delta.description: Amount to add to the existing counter value.

initial_value.description: Starting value used when the key does not yet exist.

ttl_seconds.description: Optional TTL override applied to the resulting counter.

name: upsert_vectors

auth.docs: Configure credentials for the selected vector store provider via ConfigManager.

idempotency_key.guidance: Combine the target namespace and sorted vector IDs to deduplicate retries.

description: Insert or update vector embeddings within the configured namespace of the active vector store backend.

namespace.description: Logical collection in which vectors are stored.

id.description: Stable identifier for the vector embedding.

values.description: Embedding components ordered to match the provider index dimensionality.

metadata.description: Optional metadata stored alongside the vector.

name: query_vectors

auth.docs: Configure credentials for the selected vector store provider via ConfigManager.

idempotency_key.guidance: Use the namespace and a hash of the query vector when deduplicating identical lookups.

description: Return the most similar vectors for the supplied query embedding from the configured namespace.

query.description: Embedding vector to compare against stored items.

top_k.description: Maximum number of matches to return.

filter.description: Optional metadata filter applied prior to similarity scoring.

include_values.description: When true, include stored vector values alongside metadata.

name: delete_namespace

auth.docs: Configure credentials for the selected vector store provider via ConfigManager.

idempotency_key.guidance: Use the namespace identifier to guarantee idempotent delete requests.

description: Remove all stored embeddings associated with the specified namespace.

name: task_queue_enqueue

idempotency_key.guidance: Derive a deterministic token from the task payload and logical identifier when retrying enqueue requests.

description: Enqueue a one-off task into the durable task queue with optional execution delay.

payload.description: JSON-serialisable payload forwarded to the task executor.

delay_seconds.description: Optional delay in seconds before the task is executed.

run_at.description: Absolute timestamp (ISO 8601) when the task should run. Overrides delay_seconds when provided.

idempotency_key.description: Deterministic key used to deduplicate enqueue requests.

name: task_queue_schedule

idempotency_key.guidance: Reuse the same idempotency key when recreating a cron schedule to avoid duplicate jobs.

description: Register or replace a cron-style recurring task in the durable queue.

cron_schedule.description: Standard cron expression describing when the task should execute.

cron_fields.description: Optional structured cron field mapping passed directly to the scheduler.

payload.description: JSON-serialisable payload forwarded to the executor each run.

idempotency_key.description: Deterministic key used to deduplicate cron registrations.

name: task_queue_cancel

idempotency_key.guidance: Reuse the job identifier as the idempotency token when retrying cancel requests.

description: Cancel a queued or scheduled task.

job_id.description: Identifier returned when the task or schedule was created.

idempotency_key.description: Token used to deduplicate cancel attempts, typically the job_id.

name: task_queue_status

idempotency_key.guidance: Optional token mirroring the job_id to aid with caching status requests.

description: Retrieve the current state and retry metadata for a queued task.

job_id.description: Identifier of the task or schedule to inspect.

name: browser_lite

idempotency_key.guidance: Combine the normalized start URL and persona identifier to deduplicate retries.

description: Navigate a limited number of allowlisted pages with robots.txt enforcement, throttling, and optional screenshots.

url.description: Starting URL to visit. Must belong to an allowlisted domain.

actions.description: Optional sequence of follow-up actions such as navigation or form submission.

url.description: Target URL for the action. Relative paths resolve against the previous page.

method.description: HTTP method to use for the action.

data.description: Form payload submitted when using submit_form.

allow_forms.description: Enable high-risk form submissions. Persona policy must also permit the action.

take_screenshot.description: Capture a PNG screenshot for each visited page when supported.

extract_text.description: Return sanitized page text for each visit.

max_pages.description: Override the per-session navigation cap when below the configured ceiling.

name: calculator
description: Evaluate sanitized mathematical expressions with Decimal precision and optional unit conversions.

precision.description: Optional precision override for Decimal evaluation.

variables.description: Optional mapping of variable names to numeric values.

input_unit.description: Source unit to associate with the computed value before conversion.

output_unit.description: Target unit when performing a conversion.
